definition[0]: a long continuous moving band of rubber, cloth, or metal, used in a place such as a factory or an airport to move things from one place to another
example[0]: We lifted our baggage from the conveyor belt.
definition[1]: a long continuous moving band of rubber, metal etc, used in a place such as a factory or an airport to move things from one place to another
example[1]: The sandwiches are placed on a conveyor belt and moved through two sets of cutters, one above and one below the belt.
